image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The acting justice acknowledged the accused's troubled childhood and recommended that rehabilitation be considered in his sentencing.

title.children: Judge says village responsible for raising car thief 'failed him'

image.altText: A man in front of court signage.

props.synopsis: The ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal orders a Canberra builder to pay almost $25,000 to a pair of homeowners who went to court over defects at the property.

title.children: 'Nothing to hide': Builder denies defects after homeowners win in court

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day.

props.synopsis: Canberra has been overtaken by Brisbane in the latest national rental data, with the median rent now sitting at $677 per week — far below the $796 per week in top-of-the-table Sydney.

title.children: Canberra drops to fourth most expensive capital city to rent

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court hears it was not a "legitimate expectation" of witnesses at the inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution that material they provided wouldn't be disclosed to media.

title.children: Sofronoff could conduct Lehrmann inquiry 'as he sees fit', lawyers argue

image.altText: A man with a white beard and hair wearing a black suit smiling.

props.synopsis: Former Australian National University chancellor, Gareth Evans, says proposed cost-saving cuts to the institution have "ignored or gravely under-valued the significance of ANU's very distinctive national mission".

title.children: Former ANU chancellor says proposed uni cuts 'gobsmacking'

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old Canberra woman is charged with aggravated cruelty to an animal causing death after Rangers found her dog Chisel in her backyard barely responsive, bloated and suffering.

title.children: Woman banned from owning pet for neglecting her dog so badly it died

image.altText: David Pocock smiles while speaking in the Senate

props.synopsis: As the brand new parliament resumed, Pauline Hanson chose David Pocock, Ali France made her first speech and Labor MPs squished into their section.

title.children: Pocock goes quiet as Katter finds his voice on parliament's first day

image.altText: Three volunteers hand out assistance at a help desk.

props.synopsis: The ACT government scraps a plan to begin charging volunteers $11 to register for a Working with Vulnerable People card following backlash from community groups, the opposition and the crossbench.

title.children: ACT government backs down on second budget measure

image.altText: A man in traditional Pacific island dress dances in front of protestors calling for climate action

props.synopsis: The opinion of the International Court of Justice is seen by some as a turning point in international climate law, with judges finding that states affected by global warming could be eligible for reparations.

title.children: The world's highest court declares states have a legal obligation to tackle climate change

image.altText: Donald Trump, Melania Knauss, Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell pose for a photograph in a party

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump was allegedly told his name was in the Epstein files multiple times, according to senior administration officials who spoke to The Wall Street Journal.

title.children: Trump reportedly told his name in Epstein files

image.altText: Emmanuel, in a blue suit, raises a hand to acknowledge photographers as Brigitte, in a white skirt suit, holds his arm.

props.synopsis: Candace Owens, a right-wing American podcaster, has repeatedly claimed the French president's wife used to be a man.

title.children: French president sues US influencer over claims his wife was born a man

image.altText: A child sits on a wall with a bike nearby

props.synopsis: A new report from Victoria Legal Aid reveals a rise in the number of children being placed on violence intervention orders, with some as young as 10 years old.

title.children: 'How does this help?': Families fight intervention orders forced on their child

image.altText: A supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: Workers employed under the award system could not have penalty or overtime rates bargained away under new government legislation to be introduced today.

title.children: Labor seeks to legislate to protect penalty rates for award workers

image.altText: A red Australia Post electric sign

props.synopsis: A superannuation fund does not know how many members have been impacted after mail was stolen from Australia Post in Melbourne's CBD.

title.children: Security breach for super fund after Australia Post mail theft

image.altText: Shorthead seahorses found washed up at Hallett Cove.

props.synopsis: An independent group of marine scientists from around Australia has released a seven-point plan to tackle what it describes as South Australia's "catastrophic" toxic algal bloom.

title.children: Seven steps scientists say will tackle toxic algal bloom

image.altText: Signs outside a courthouse read "Supreme Court" and "District Court".

props.synopsis: An unnamed hospital applied to the Supreme Court for orders after being asked to perform a surgical termination for the child who was about nine weeks pregnant.

title.children: Hospital given permission by Supreme Court to terminate 12yo's pregnancy

image.altText: Rows of babies in cardboard boxes strapped into the seats of a commercial aeroplane.

props.synopsis: In the closing weeks of the Vietnam War, hundreds of orphaned babies and children were airlifted to Australia for a new life, but not all of them were adopted.

title.children: In 1975, hundreds of babies were put in boxes and flown to Australia

image.altText: ATM blurred

props.synopsis: The move follows an ABC investigation which found ATM companies were cutting deals with tobacco criminals.

title.children: ABC investigation sparks removal of ATMs from suspected illegal tobacco stores

image.altText: Black and white still of a brunette man in a dark turtleneck reading from a storybook, humpty dumpty toy sitting behind him

props.synopsis: Donald Macdonald was many things over his 87 years, including a Play School host, a playwright, and a friend.

title.children: Remembering the 'gentle spirit' who hosted first seasons of Play School

image.altText: Illustration of lizard-like creatures, each with a striped crest made of long feather-like structures on its back.

props.synopsis: A strange crest found on ancient reptile fossils suggests birds and dinosaurs may not have the exclusive lock on feather-like features.

title.children: 'Wonderous reptile' fossil discovery deepens feather evolution puzzle

image.altText: A crowd of young people at Byron Bay's Beach hotel.

props.synopsis: NSW government plans to trial an "entertainment precinct" in Byron Bay are being hotly debated after a community-led meeting raised concerns about alcohol-fuelled violence.

title.children: Community concerns grow over Byron Bay entertainment precinct

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: Fill-in childcare workers won't be included in the first stage of Victoria's new childcare worker registration scheme when it begins next month.

title.children: Worries 'red flags' may go undetected when new childcare scheme begins

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: Special legislation to fast-track the approval process for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium could be overtaken by the original Project of State Significance process, as the snap election interrupts voting timelines.

title.children: Delay on Hobart stadium reopens door for planning commission process

image.altText: aerial view of cleared land at a proposed mine site.

props.synopsis: The mining company has defended its actions at the proposed Gemini mine site in central Queensland, and says work has been done in accordance with state and federal laws.

title.children: Mining company allegedly begins clearing land for unapproved mine

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: Dr Salvador Plasencia is charged with four counts of illegal distribution of the drug ketamine.

title.children: Doctor pleads guilty to supplying ketamine to Matthew Perry

image.altText: A woman with her curly hair tied back walks outside a window

props.synopsis: Lauren Austin admits kissing a teenage girl who was under her supervision and pleads guilty to sexual offences.

title.children: Former coach of Australia's female indoor hockey team admits sexual offences

image.altText: Steven May stands with his hands on his hips during an AFL match.

props.synopsis: Steven May says he is shocked he did not arrive to the ball first, but the AFL tribunal has found him guilty over the collision that concussed Francis Evans.

title.children: Demons' May handed three-match ban for controversial collision

image.altText: Four women at the rugby union. wearing Australia Wallabies clothing

props.synopsis: With the Tom Richards Cup on the line, the Wallabies will be counting on the golden army turning out in Melbourne, where rugby union carved out its own slice of history 24 years ago.

title.children: Wallabies look for another golden moment in Melbourne against the Lions

image.altText: Two men raise fists in the air while celebrating, surrounded by other happy happy.

props.synopsis: Manipulation of the London Inter-Bank Offered Rate (Libor) and its euro equivalent Euribor occurred in the run-up to and following the 2008 global financial crisis.

title.children: Top UK court quashes ex-bankers' rate rigging convictions

image.altText: John Torode and Gregg Wallace sitting together at a table with a pile of saucepans on either side of them

props.synopsis: Two of the shows hosts were sacked by the broadcaster after a report into the program's internal culture.

title.children: BBC to air MasterChef UK series featuring sacked presenters

image.altText: A jet being refuelled in the sky

props.synopsis: The exercise will see more than 400 aircraft and 12,000 personnel from the US, Australia and other countries such as Canada, France and Japan conduct exercises over 50 locations across the Pacific region.

title.children: 'We'll fight and win': US's biggest-ever Pacific exercise 'directed at China'

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump announces a trade deal with Japan that he says will result in Japan investing $US550 billion ($842 billion) into the United States and paying a 15 per cent reciprocal tariff.

title.children: Trump says 'massive' trade deal with Japan has been struck

image.altText: colbert during taping

props.synopsis: John Oliver, Jimmy Fallon, Jon Stewart and Seth Meyers have appeared in the audience during a sketch in the host's first show after news The Late Show was cancelled by CBS.

title.children: Colbert tells Trump the 'gloves are off' as late-night hosts rally amid cancellation

image.altText: Sussan Ley sits in the opposition leader's chair in question time.

props.synopsis: By the time the prime minister called an end to Question Time, all those who'd started the proceedings had survived the debut outing for the 48th parliament.

title.children: Question Time had been going for a minute before an MP was in trouble

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Police have seized an Elvis T-shirt, drink bottle and a wristband from Port Lincoln scrubland on Wednesday as their search continues for the missing remains of the alleged murder victim.

title.children: Police seize Elvis T-shirt and other items in Julian Story search
